author: chris2_2_2
content: The fact is that searchers (the ones doing mev) have a lot of money risked if the validator they are using screws them. Plus its a lot of work to deal with multiple parties. So they'd much prefer to deal with one large pool over individual validators. Individuals/small pools also lack the development team/skills to make their own mev bots. MEV is going to lead to a few large pools dominating the network or possibly even just 1 pool holding 51%. Especially when one is publicly traded, insured, and licensed giving it a massive financial and security advantage over the others. Just like cellphones there is going to be an Apple that everyone flocks to because 1 massive corporation can do it better than a bunch of small ones. There are economies of scale here strongly pushing centralization.
